user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_SocketSendTo_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_SocketSendTo_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, const void *buffer, size_t buflen,
                           const OS_SockAddr_t *RemoteAddr)
{
    int                             os_result;
    socklen_t                       addrlen;
    const struct sockaddr *         sa;
    OS_impl_file_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_filehandle_table, *token);

    sa = (const struct sockaddr *)&RemoteAddr->AddrData;
    switch (sa->sa_family)
    {
        case AF_INET:
            addrlen = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in);
            break;
#ifdef OS_NETWORK_SUPPORTS_IPV6
        case AF_INET6:
            addrlen = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in6);
            break;
#endif
        default:
            addrlen = 0;
            break;
    }

    if (addrlen != RemoteAddr->ActualLength)
    {
        return OS_ERR_BAD_ADDRESS;
    }

    os_result = sendto(impl->fd, buffer, buflen, MSG_DONTWAIT, sa, addrlen);
    if (os_result < 0)
    {
        OS_DEBUG("sendto: %s\n", strerror(errno));
        return OS_ERROR;
    }

    return os_result;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_SocketSendTo_Impl:
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
extern OS_impl_file_internal_record_t OS_impl_filehandle_table[OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_FILES]
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
typedef struct
{
    int  fd;
    bool selectable;
} OS_impl_file_internal_record_t
...
typedef struct
{
    size_t            ActualLength; /**< @brief Length of the actual address data */
    OS_SockAddrData_t AddrData;     /**< @brief Abstract Address data */
} OS_SockAddr_t
...
static inline osal_index_t OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_idx;
}
...
#define OS_DEBUG(__VA_ARGS__) 
...
#define OS_ERR_BAD_ADDRESS (-34)
...
#define OS_ERROR (-1)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No compiler language extensions are used in the provided code fragment. The constructs that might commonly be mistaken for extensions are all standard C (C99 or later) or library/POSIX APIs, so they do not violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2:

- static inline function (OS_ObjectIndexFromToken): standard C (inline is part of C99/C11).
- Variadic macro usage (OS_DEBUG(__VA_ARGS__)): variadic macros are standard since C99.
- Use of bool in structs: stdbool/_Bool is standard since C99.
- Pointer casts such as (const struct sockaddr *)&RemoteAddr->AddrData and indexed array access (&tbl[...]): standard C pointer and array operations.
- Preprocessor conditional compilation (#ifdef OS_NETWORK_SUPPORTS_IPV6): standard preprocessor feature.
- Use of POSIX types and APIs (socklen_t, sendto, MSG_DONTWAIT, strerror, errno): these are platform/POSIX APIs, not language extensions; MISRA Rule 1.2 concerns compiler language extensions.

No occurrences of known compiler-specific extensions were found (e.g., typeof, __attribute__, __builtin_*, asm, statement-expressions ({ ... }), nested functions, GCC/Clang __attribute__ syntax, or other vendor-specific keywords). Therefore there are no suspicious fragments to escalate for Rule 1.2 investigation.
